授業方法:
This course is currently planned for face-to-face format with online synchronous sessions, as needed. Weekly meetings mostly consist of mini lectures, reading-based discussions, survey / interview development workshops, data analysis sessions, individual and group presentations, Graduation Thesis writing workshops, and peer and instructor feedback sessions. Students will also plan, rehearse for, and present at the Research Fair in November.

[Information for students with university permission to take classes online]
When possible, face-to-face lessons will be held simultaneously on Zoom. When that is not possible, live classes will be recorded for on-demand access. Students permitted to take classes online are expected to join live classes via Zoom when offered, watch recorded on-demand classes, and complete / submit the required assignments according to the course schedule.

トピック.授業計画1: The primary focus of this fourth-year seminar is the successful completion of the Graduation Thesis. Students will pair up on selected Junior Thesis research projects. Having proposed and designed the study, students will now work together in pairs to implement the research by: 1) developing research tools (e.g., surveys, interviews, observation tasks, etc.), 2) conducting fieldwork in order to collect data, 3) analyzing data and interpreting results, and 4) writing their Graduation Thesis. Students will report on their research progress, receive guidance on academic thesis research and writing, and give presentations on their final thesis. Students will present at the Research Fair in November and submit their Graduation Thesis by the December deadline.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Student preparation outside of class meetings includes:
(1) Weekly preparation assignments, including carefully reading English academic journal articles and completing preparation tasks,
(2) Conducting literature research for their Graduation Thesis,
(3) Developing research instruments (surveys and interviews),
(4) Collecting and analyzing data,
(5) Preparation for thesis oral progress reports and formal presentations, and
(6) Writing, using peer and instructor feedback, and revising Graduation Thesis drafts.

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Active participation, submission of assignments that meet the requirements by the deadlines, giving presentations, completing the Graduation Thesis according to all stated requirements. Attendance is expected, but there will be some leniency for job hunting schedule conflicts.
